lead_paragraph: An appeals court panel said the director of Consumer Financial Protection Bureau was too independent, so it gave the president the power to fire him at will.

headline.print_headline: Court Upholds Consumer Agency, Minus Its Leader’s Job Security
headline.main: Court Gives President More Power Over Consumer Agency Chief

snippet: An appeals court panel said the director of Consumer Financial Protection Bureau was too independent, so it gave the president the power to fire him at will....
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for District of Columbia Circuit rules Consumer Financial Protection Bureau's structure is unconstitutional in improperly granting too much power and autonomy to one director, ruling instead that president should have power to fire director at will; decision addresses longstanding criticism of agency but stops short of making major changes that its critics had been calling for.
